IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDIFY AND INSPIRE STUDENTS AND EDUCATORS TO GROW, LEARN AND LEAD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE EDIFY AND INSPIRE STUDENTS AND EDUCATORS TO GROW, LEARN AND LEAD.
IRS990.Desc: ASPEN ACADEMY IS AN INDEPENDENT SCHOOL SERVING APPROXIMATELY 400 STUDENTS FROM PREK THROUGH 8TH GRADE. WE EDIFY AND INSPIRE STUDENTS, PARENTS AND EDUCATORS TO GROW, LEARN AND LEAD. WE ARE A NATIONAL LEADER IN INNOVATIVE AND TRANSFORMATIVE EDUCATION. ASPEN ACADEMY'S STUDENTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS HOLD THE SAME VALUES: BE KIND, DO GOOD, WORK HARD AND MAKE THE WORLD BETTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 2D
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROGRAM EXPENSES NETTED WITH INCOME ON AUDITED FINANCIALS -31,907 TUITION ASSISTANCE NETTED WITH INCOME IN AUDITED FINANCIAL -319,434

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TUITION ASSISTANCE NETTED WITH INCOME ON AUDITED FINANCIAL 319,434 PROGRAM EXPENSES NETTED WITH INCOME ON AUDITED FINANCIALS 31,907
ASPEN PREP ACADEMY POSTS AN AD IN THE DENVER POST NEWSPAPER ANNUALLY STATING ITS NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FINANCIAL AID AT ASPEN ACADEMY IS AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED NEED. THIS IS DETERMINED BY FACTORS SUCH AS INCOME, NUMBER OF CHILDREN AGE OF PARENTS, UNUSUAL MEDICAL EXPENSES, TAXES, ASSETS, LIABLITIES, AND OTHER TUITION-BASED SCHOOLS. APPLICANTS APPLY ONLINE AND RESULTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE, WHICH MAKES AWARD DETERMINATIONS BASED ON NEXT YEAR'S FINANCIAL AID BUDGET. FUNDS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 4

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SECTION A, LINE 1A: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL CONSIST OF OFFICERS OF THE BOARD (CHAIR OF THE BOARD, VICE-CHAIR OF THE BOARD, FINANCE AND AUDIT COMMITTEE CHAIR, AND TRUSTEE AND GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR) AND THE PRESIDENT OF THE CORPORATION. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY EXERCISE ALL CORPORATE POWERS THAT MAY BE EXERCISED BY THE BOARD AT SUCH TIMES AS THE BOARD IS NOT IN SESSION, AND WILL HAVE RESPONSIBILITY OVER THE GENERAL MANAGEMENT OF THE CORPORATION, TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW AND THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION DURING THE INTERVALS BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE POWER TO FILL ANY COMMITTEE VACANCIES, SUBJECT, HOWEVER TO THE APPROVAL BY THE BOARD AT ITS NEXT MEETING. THE COMMITTEE WILL NOT HAVE THE POWER TO ALTER OR REVOKE ANY PREVIOUS ORDER, RESOLUTION, OR VOTE OF A MEETING OF THE BOARD, UNLESS SPECIFICALLY GRANTED SUCH POWER BY THE BOARD, APPROVE OR RECOMMEND DISSOLUTION, MERGER, OR THE SALE, PLEDGE OR TRANSFER OF ALL OR SUBSTANTIALLY ALL OF THE ASSETS OF THE CORPORATION, ELECT, APPOINT, OR REMOVE TRUSTEES OR FILL VACANCIES ON THE BOARD, OR ADOPT, AMEND, OR REPEAL THE BYLAWS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE PRESIDENT, THE SUCCESSION PLAN FOR LEADERSHIP OF THE CORPORATION.

THE BUSINESS MANAGER AND DIRECTOR OF BUSINESS AND OPERATIONS REVIEW THE 990 AND REPORT THEIR ANALYSIS TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING THE REPORT. IN ADDITION, AN ELECTRONIC COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ANY INDIVIDUAL IN A POSITION TO EXERCISE SUBSTANTIAL INFLUENCE OVER THE AFFAIRS OF THE ORGANIZATION, WHICH SPECIFICALLY INCLUDES OFFICERS AND TRUSTEES OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE EXISTENCE OF ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. IF CONFLICTS ARE DETERMINED, THE PERSON WITH THE CONFLICT IS EXCLUDED FROM THE MEETING/DECISION AND WILL REFRAIN FROM VOTING ON THE MATTER.

COMPENSATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL AND SENIOR DIRECTORS IS REVIEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY AN INDEPENDENT COMMITTEE USING ANALYSIS FROM BOTH INTERNAL (PERFORMANCE REVIEW) AND EXTERNAL SOURCES (COMPARABLE WAGES FOR PROFESSION IN THE AREA) WRITTEN SUBSTANTIATION IS INCLUDED IN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MINUTES AS DOCUMENTATION FOR COMPENSATION DECISIONS.
SAME AS PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A.
THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THIS PROCESS DID NOT CHANGE DURING THE TAX YEAR.
